Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and security. Identify the applications and services that will use the Azure SQL Managed Instance.
Design the database architecture, including schema, indexing, and partitioning strategies. Plan for high availability and disaster recovery.
Create and configure the Azure SQL Managed Instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Specify the required compute and storage resources.
Set up virtual network integration for the Azure SQL Managed Instance. Configure subnets, private endpoints, and firewall rules to secure access.
Enable security features such as Transparent Data Encryption (TDE), Advanced Threat Protection, and role-based access control (RBAC). Configure auditing and data masking as needed.
Plan and execute the migration of existing databases to Azure SQL Managed Instance using tools like Azure Database Migration Service or native backup and restore.
Set up automated backups and define retention policies. Test restore procedures to ensure data recovery capabilities.
Monitor and optimize database performance using tools like Query Store, Index Tuning, and Azure Monitor. Address bottlenecks and ensure efficient query execution.
Set up monitoring and alerting for database health, performance, and security using Azure Monitor and Log Analytics.
Test failover scenarios to ensure high availability configurations are functioning correctly. Validate the setup for disaster recovery.
Document the database architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
